People often assume that mental illnesses ‘exist’ in the same way that broken bones exist and can be revealed by medical tests in the same way. However, there are many different theories as to what causes experiences such as hearing voices. The idea that they are symptoms of illness, perhaps caused by some sort of chemical imbalance or other problem in the brain, is just one of the theories. There is no objective biological test such as a blood test or scan for diagnosing mental illness. There is a vigorous debate about whether it is meaningful or useful to think of these experiences as symptoms of mental illnesses.
